title: June Inflation Rises to 2.7%, Still Lower Than Past Peaks
snippets: Consumer prices were up 2.7% from a year ago — a larger annual increase than the month before.

Inflation remains far below the peaks seen three years ago, when price increases reached as high as 9%

Inflation shot up in June as the impacts of Donald Trump’s tariffs slowly started to show in US prices.

Business leaders have said for months that the high, volatile rates of Trump’s
The Consumer Price Index increased 0.3 per cent last month after edging up 0.1 per cent in May, the Labor Department's Bureau of Labor Statistics said on Tuesday.
titles: Inflation heats up in June as President Trump's tariffs start to bite
US inflation rose in June as Trump’s tariffs start to show in prices
U.S. inflation rose by 2.7% in June. How tariffs are making an impact
summary: Consumer prices rose by 2.7% compared to last year, marking a slight increase from the previous month. This inflation rate, though higher than the month before, remains significantly lower than the peaks of 9% seen three years ago. The rise in inflation in June is attributed to the gradual effects of Donald Trump's tariffs. Despite the increase, the Consumer Price Index showed a modest monthly rise of 0.3% in June after a 0.1% increase in May, according to the Labor Department's Bureau of Labor Statistics.
constructiveness_reason: This story is informative and provides useful context about the current state of inflation compared to previous years. It also provides insight into the causes of the inflation increase, which can help readers understand the economic trends and impacts. However, it doesn't report on any solutions or improvements to the situation.

title: India Orders Boeing 787, 737 Fuel Lock Checks After Air India Incident
